data.text: @jfraze123 @TIME There's a whole list of reasons why victims don't come forward, and I'm commenting on the tough guy act from Brad Pitt specifically, but seeing as you referred to the victims with scare-quotes as "accusers" I'm guessing this is wasted time here.

@mezdispenser @TIME I'm agreeing with you that celebraties know. And while they are well within their rights to mind their own business and technically owe nothing to the general public, it does poke holes into their holier-than-you, community stewards they like to pretend to be.
@TIME Didn't the article go on to say that Pitt went up & spoke to Weinstein, alone? So what Pitt told Paltrow isn't necessarily fact.

@TIME Talk is talk @jonvoight If pit had any ❤ he'd have at least tuned him up as I'm sure someone will someday* he probably had a piece of his ass but pit wouldn't kick his ass. Did U even say anything to Harvey Jon? I wouldn't kill him but if I ever met him I don't think I'd be nice
@BestKoreaBot @TIME The existence of the casting couch porn subgenre has nothing to do with specific celebrities remaining quiet about specific assaults they knew about.
@mezdispenser @TIME Pretty much, you never seen casting videos?
@BestKoreaBot @TIME There's a whole Weinstein porn sub-genre?
@mezdispenser @TIME Brad’s only pissed he made a pass at his girl. Everyone knew what was happening in hollywood. We even have a whole porn genre about it for gods sake.

@mezdispenser @TIME That type of shit went on for years in addition to him actually raping or committing non consensual sex acts or making creepy passes at women.  So everyone probably just thought any girl speaking up got something out of it.  It blows my mind that no one stood up to it back then

@mezdispenser @TIME For instance the Rose McGowen allegations deal with him promising her movie roles or directing opportunities for her then BF Robert Rodriguez.  Despicable, wrong, abuse of power, disgusting.  Whatever you want to call it.. but is was also a agreed upon arrangement.

@mezdispenser @TIME I agree with you here. Unfortunately in Hollywood Weinstein being a creep is something everyone knew but did nothing “legitimate” about.  It’s one of the longest running jokes.  One of the saddest parts about it is all the deals and no disclosure agreements signed around this

@TIME Or he could have... you know... said something? If only Brad Pitt was a major celebrity with an amplified voice who could have warned people of the behavior he was obviously aware of... but nah, so cool, he threatened to kill Weinstein, so brave. https://t.co/a9hhpc6sUX
@TIME that does impress me much https://t.co/LNxCaVD5Hk
